1. This sign means:
column4: Road slippery when wet. Drive slowly.

column2: 5. What should you do if one of your tires blows out?
column4: Hold the steering wheel tight and brake immediately to avoid the risk of skidding.
column6: Hold the steering wheel tight and slowly take your foot off the gas pedal.
column8: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other vehicles.

7. This road sign means:
column8: Keep right, traffic is entering from another road.

column2: 8. As you drive on the expressway, make sure:
column6: you cut off vehicles behind you when you change lanes.
column8: your directional signal goes off before you change lanes.

column2: 9. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they are within 100 feet of a railroad crossing on a two-way roadway.
column6: they can not safely return to the right lane before they reach a solid yellow center line for the right lane.
column8: they approach the top of a hill on a two-way road and can not see over it.

column2: 10. Drowsy drivers:
column4: can stay awake by opening a window.
column6: should drink coffee to stay awake.
column8: are at risk of being involved in a crash.

column8: Avoid eye contact with the aggressive driver.
column10: Challenge the aggressive driver with increased speed.

19. When they see a yellow X signal, drivers should:
column4: prepare to leave the lane safely.
column8: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

column2: 20. Two solid yellow lines on the pavement mean:
column4: passing is allowed for both drivers.
column6: passing is allowed during daylight only.
column10: passing is allowed if you are at the top of a hill.

column2: 21. This sign means:
column10: There is a traffic signal ahead

column2: 22. If you stop along the road at night:
column4: turn on your emergency flashers and leave your low beams on.
column10: turn off your emergency lights and leave your high beams on.

column2: 23. When driving on a wet road:
column4: you should follow the vehicle ahead of you more closely.
column6: you must be aware that the pavement gets even more slippery when it's been raining for long periods of time.
column8: as you drive faster, your tires may lose traction.
column10: as you decrease your speed, the road becomes more slippery.

column2: 24. A driver who approaches an intersection:
column4: must drive straight through the intersection, even if another vehicle is already in the intersection.
column6: has the right-of-way over traffic already in the intersection.
column8: must yield the right-of-way to traffic already in the intersection.

column2: 25. To avoid having to make an emergency stop while driving in traffic, drivers should:
column4: sound their horn to warn other drivers.
column6: look ahead and maintain a safe following distance.
column8: drive in the right lane only.
column10: drive slower than the flow of traffic.
